Tasks.Name: Understanding Pencil Grades and Techniques
Tasks.Description: Learn about different pencil grades (hardness and softness) and their effects on line weight and shading.

Subtasks.Name: Pencil Grades
Subtasks.Description: Explore the range of pencil grades (e.g., 9H, 2H, HB, 2B, 9B) and their characteristics.

Subtasks.Name: Pencil Techniques
Subtasks.Description: Learn basic pencil techniques like hatching, cross-hatching, blending, and stippling.

Tasks.Name: Drawing Basic Shapes and Forms
Tasks.Description: Practice drawing fundamental shapes (circles, squares, triangles) and simple geometric forms (cubes, spheres, cylinders).

Subtasks.Name: Drawing Geometric Shapes
Subtasks.Description: Master drawing basic shapes accurately using a ruler and compass.

Subtasks.Name: Drawing Simple Forms
Subtasks.Description: Learn to draw 3D forms by applying shading and perspective techniques.

Tasks.Name: Observational Drawing
Tasks.Description: Develop your observation skills by drawing from real-life objects and subjects.

Subtasks.Name: Still Life Drawing
Subtasks.Description: Practice drawing simple still life arrangements (e.g., fruit, flowers, everyday objects).

Subtasks.Name: Drawing from Photographs
Subtasks.Description: Use photographs as references to practice drawing various subjects.

Subtasks.Name: Drawing Human Figures
Subtasks.Description: Learn basic proportions and anatomy for drawing human figures.

Tasks.Name: Shading and Light and Shadow
Tasks.Description: Master shading techniques to create realistic depth and dimension in your drawings.

Subtasks.Name: Understanding Light and Shadow
Subtasks.Description: Learn about light sources, highlights, shadows, and midtones.

Subtasks.Name: Shading Techniques
Subtasks.Description: Practice different shading techniques like blending, cross-hatching, and stippling to create realistic effects.

Subtasks.Name: Drawing with Value Scales
Subtasks.Description: Use value scales to create accurate tonal transitions in your drawings.

Subtasks.Name: Drawing from Life
Subtasks.Description: Continue practicing observational drawing from real-life subjects, focusing on light and shadow.

Tasks.Name: Perspective and Composition
Tasks.Description: Learn about perspective and composition to create realistic and visually appealing drawings.

Subtasks.Name: One-Point Perspective
Subtasks.Description: Understand the basics of one-point perspective and practice drawing objects in this perspective.

Subtasks.Name: Two-Point Perspective
Subtasks.Description: Learn about two-point perspective and practice drawing objects and scenes in this perspective.

Subtasks.Name: Composition Basics
Subtasks.Description: Learn about composition principles like rule of thirds, balance, and focal point.

Subtasks.Name: Creating a Composition
Subtasks.Description: Practice creating compositions using perspective and composition principles.

Tasks.Name: Realistic Detailing and Refinement
Tasks.Description: Learn to add fine details and refine your drawings for a more realistic look.

Subtasks.Name: Adding Detail to Drawings
Subtasks.Description: Learn to add subtle details and textures to your drawings using various pencil techniques.

Subtasks.Name: Refining Drawings
Subtasks.Description: Practice refining your drawings by adjusting lines, shading, and details.

Subtasks.Name: Drawing Complex Subjects
Subtasks.Description: Challenge yourself by drawing more complex subjects like portraits, landscapes, or animals.

Subtasks.Name: Creating a Portfolio
Subtasks.Description: Start building a portfolio of your best drawings to showcase your progress and skills.
